channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Harris courts undecided voters. And, is Trump’s mass deportation plan feasible?
item.description: Vice President Harris delivered the closing pitch in her campaign yesterday, reaching out to undecided voters in swing states. And, a look at whether Trump's mass deportation plan is feasible.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Harris delivered the closing pitch in her campaign yesterday, reaching out to undecided voters in swing states. And, a look at whether Trump's mass deportation plan is feasible.

(Image credit: Kent Nishimura)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Biden's 'garbage' remarks give Trump and GOP new fodder on the trail
item.description: It sounded like the president was calling Trump supporters "garbage." But the White House said he was talking about a joke made by a comedian at a Trump rally who disparaged Puerto Rico.
item.content:encoded:
It sounded like the president was calling Trump supporters "garbage." But the White House said he was talking about a joke made by a comedian at a Trump rally who disparaged Puerto Rico.

(Image credit: Ting Shen)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: With much at stake, labor unions knock on millions of doors in final campaign push
item.description: With much at stake on Election Day, labor unions have deployed canvassers to knock on doors in swing states. With polling tight, the focus is on turning out the vote.
item.content:encoded:
With much at stake on Election Day, labor unions have deployed canvassers to knock on doors in swing states. With polling tight, the focus is on turning out the vote.

(Image credit: Andrea Hsu)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: A baseless voting claim is being amplified by a network of social media accounts
item.description: It’s unclear who runs the network of social media accounts that has gotten millions of views amplifying trending claims about alleged voting fraud.
item.content:encoded:
It’s unclear who runs the network of social media accounts that has gotten millions of views amplifying trending claims about alleged voting fraud.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Huo Jingnan

item.title: Americans bet $100 million on Trump v. Harris, but at what cost?
item.description: Political prognosticators legally bet over $100 million on the 2024 presidential election, favoring Harris over Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Political prognosticators legally bet over $100 million on the 2024 presidential election, favoring Harris over Trump.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: Kids in Iowa's capital will trick-or-treat on Halloween for the 1st time since 1938
item.description: Kids in the greater metro area of Iowa's capital city typically go trick-or-treating the night before Halloween, a tradition that began in the 1930s as a way to help prevent vandalism.
item.content:encoded:
Kids in the greater metro area of Iowa's capital city typically go trick-or-treating the night before Halloween, a tradition that began in the 1930s as a way to help prevent vandalism.

(Image credit: Charlie Neibergall)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Voting officials face ‘an uphill battle’ to fight election lies
item.description: The deck is stacked against election officials online, maybe even more so than in 2020. Conspiracy theories can quickly get millions of views while debunks gather a fraction of the attention.
item.content:encoded:
The deck is stacked against election officials online, maybe even more so than in 2020. Conspiracy theories can quickly get millions of views while debunks gather a fraction of the attention.

(Image credit: Yasuyoshi Chiba)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: Central Asia’s Ticking Time Bomb: Water
item.description: The Aral Sea has nearly disappeared over the last 60 years. Now, its source rivers are depleting.
item.content:encoded:
The Aral Sea has nearly disappeared over the last 60 years. Now, its source rivers are depleting.

(Image credit: Claire Harbage)
item.dc:creator: Valerie Kipnis

item.title: Why are some Evangelicals drawn to — and sticking by — Trump? This pastor weighs in
item.description: NPR sits down with North Carolina pastor Chad Harvey to talk about Donald Trump, religion and politics.
item.content:encoded:
NPR sits down with North Carolina pastor Chad Harvey to talk about Donald Trump, religion and politics.

(Image credit: Andrea Ellen Reed for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: The rules of war aren't protecting civilians. Can they be enforced?
item.description: The Geneva Conventions recently marked their 75th anniversary, yet the rules of war are being widely violated. NPR’s Greg Myre reports from two ongoing wars, Russia-Ukraine and Israel-Hamas.
item.content:encoded:
The Geneva Conventions recently marked their 75th anniversary, yet the rules of war are being widely violated. NPR’s Greg Myre reports from two ongoing wars, Russia-Ukraine and Israel-Hamas.

(Image credit: Alex Babenko)
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre
